member.name: T:AntPlus.Types.BindableObject
member.summary: Base class for objects available for data binding. This class implements a few helper methods to make it easier to implement INotifyPropertyChanged. Subclasses of BindableObject will notify the UI about changes in values of their properties. Make sure to use the Set method inside the setters of the properties for the magic to happen. This class does not need to be used externally by scripts, but is useful when implementing new profiles and data pages.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Types.BindableObject.RegisterDependencies(AntPlus.Types.BindableObject)
member.summary: This method should be called in the constructor of derived classes to allow them to register dependencies

member.summary: Can be used by derived classes to simplify the implementation of INotifyPropertyChanged
member.param: Name of the backing field for this property
Property name. Must exactly match the name of the property.

member.summary: Derived classes inherit this method to simplify the implementation of INotifyPropertyChanged Do not override.
member.param: Name of the property that changed

member.name: T:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler
member.summary: Helper class to handle transmission pattern

member.name: F:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.BackgroundInterval
member.summary: Set the interval between background pages, i.e., set of background pages sent every Xth message.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.#ctor(System.UInt16)
member.param: Maximum supported decimation factor, as specified in the device profile. If no decimation is supported, set to 1 (default). Otherwise, it is typically set to 2 or 4. The decimation factor needs to be configured for profiles that support decimation of the channel period at the slave. This is used so that background pages are sent several times in a row, to ensure that they will be received even at the slowest channel period. Decimation factor can only be configured in the constructor.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.SetMainPage(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.DataPage)
member.summary: Configure the main data page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.GetMainPage
member.summary: Returns the data page that is currently being sent as the main data page

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.AddBackgroundPage(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.DataPage)
member.summary: Add a background page to the transmission rotation. Background pages consist of a set of pages that are rotated at a given interval, for example, alternating between page 80 and 81 every 65 messages.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.RemoveBackgroundPage(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.DataPage)
member.summary: Remove a background page from the transmission rotation

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.AddSupplementaryPage(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.DataPage,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Add a supplementary page to the transmission rotation
member.param: Transmission interval of the page (i.e., transmit once every X messages). If decimation is enabled, the page will be transmitted multiple times, so configuring an interval of 4 with decimation enabled will result in sending the page twice in a row, followed by two other pages.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.RemoveSupplementaryPage(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.DataPage)
member.summary: Remove a supplementary page from the transmission rotation

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.TransmissionScheduler.NextPage
member.summary: Get the next page to send. Main data page is transmitted most of the time, and the background pages are interleaved at the desired interval. If decimation is enabled, the background pages are transmitted multiple times in a row to ensure they are received at a receiver with decimated rate. Supplementary pages are interleaved at the desired rate, while maintaining an offset to each other Refer to the "Transmission Pattern" section on the SDM device profile for more details
member.returns: The next page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.MultiMainPageTransmissionScheduler.RemoveMainPage(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.DataPage)
member.summary: Remove a particular main page from the transmission pattern

member.summary: Configure the transmission schedule to send only one page
member.param: Page to be set as only main page

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.MultiMainPageTransmissionScheduler.Clear
member.summary: Clear all main pages. WARNING: If SetMainPage or AddMainPage are not called immediately after, undefined behaviour may result.

member.name: T:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine
member.summary: This class provides a simulation engine suitable for event driven sensors. Event driven sensors are those that update their calculations after they detect an event (e.g. a wheel/crank revolution, a heart beat, a step) Thus, the elapsed time between events fluctuates This simulator engine provides a way to calculate the number of events that take place beween two successively transmitted ANT messages, along with the time of the last event, to allow profiles for event-driven sensors to update the sensor event count and event time on each transmission. It also provides the length of the simulator interval (which should typically match the ANT channel period)

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine.Start
member.summary: Start simulation. For broadcast sensors, this should be called after opening the channel.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine.Stop
member.summary: Stop simulation Should be called once transmissions stopped

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine.Next(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate the number of events and time of the last event since the previous call to this function
member.param: Rate at which events are generated. This is a sensor specific value, derived for example from speed, heart rate, cadence, etc.
member.returns: Simulator Results, including the number of events that took place since the previous call to this function, and the time elapsed between the last event seen in the previous call to this function, and the last event seen in this call, in ms. These values can be added to the cumulative event count and cumulative event time for transmission

member.name: T:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine.SimulatorResults
member.summary: The results of the simulation iteration

member.name: F:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine.SimulatorResults.ElapsedEvents
member.summary: The number of events that took place during the last simulator interval (usually a channel period), in # events

member.name: F:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine.SimulatorResults.ElapsedTime
member.summary: The time of the last simulator event, in ms

member.name: F:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine.SimulatorResults.IntervalLength
member.summary: The actual simulator interval length, in ms (typically the channel period)

member.name: F:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.EventSimulatorEngine.SimulatorResults.EventLatency
member.summary: The time between the end of the simulator interval and the last simulator event, in ms

member.name: T:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.PageSenderMaster
member.summary: This class provides a generic mechanism for sending data pages from a master device to a slave device (i.e., in the forward direction). It supports sending broadcast and acknowledged data types, and will automatically handle retransmissions up to a specified number, or until a successful acknoledgement is received.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.PageSenderMaster.#ctor(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.ISender)
member.summary: Creates a PageSenderMaster object. An instance of a class implementing ISender (e.g., BroadcastAntMaster) needs to be passed to the constructor to allow this class to send messages as needed.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.PageSenderMaster.SendSynchronizedPage``1(``0)
member.summary: Initiates a request to send a synchronized data page
member.param: Shared page to send. The page must implement the ISynchronizedPage interface.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.PageSenderMaster.SendPage(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.DataPage,System.Boolean,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initiates a request to send a data page. Note: The page will be sent on the next channel period. If SendPage is called near the beginning of a channel period, it will be almost 1 full channel period before the page is transmitted.
member.param: Set to true to use acknowledged data type, set to false if using broadcast messages

Requested number of transmissions. If the option to send until acknowledged is selected, this parameter can be used to limit the maximum number of attempts. Set to 0 for unlimited number of transmissions (i.e., keep sending until acknowledged)
Set to true to send the message until successfully acknowledged, or the maximum number of attempts is reached.
Set to true to start sending this message right away, or false to queue it if there is an active transmission in place

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.PageSenderMaster.IsBusy
member.summary: Indicates whether currently processing a request for a data page

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.PageSenderMaster.WaitToSendResponse
member.summary: Wait until the next channel period (HandleTransmit) to send requested page

member.name: T:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.PageSenderSlave
member.summary: This class provides a generic mechanism for sending data pages from a slave device to a master device (i.e., in the reverse direction). It supports sending broadcast and acknowledged data types, and will automatically handle retransmissions up to a specified number, or until a successful acknoledgement is received.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.PageSenderSlave.#ctor(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.ISender)

member.summary: Initiates a request to send a data page. Note: The page will be sent on the next channel period. If SendPage is called near the beginning of a channel period, it will be almost 1 full channel period before the page is transmitted.
member.param: Set to true to use acknowledged data type, set to false if using broadcast messages. If the page length is larger than 8 bytes, it will be sent as a burst.

Requested number of transmissions. If the option to send until acknowledged is selected, this parameter can be used to limit the maximum number of attempts. Set to 0 for unlimited number of transmissions (i.e., keep sending until acknowledged)
Set to true to send the message until successfully acknowledged, or the maximum number of attempts is reached.
Set to true to start sending this message right away, or false to queue it if there is an active transmission in place
Delegate to call when the request is complete

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Components.SequentialTransmissionScheduler.#ctor(AntPlus.Profiles.Components.DataPage,System.Boolean)

member.summary: Add a data page to the data page sequnce at a specific index. Can initialise how many times the data page will be repeated
member.param: Number of sequential repetitions of data page

Index of data page in sequence (index of first page if page will be repeated). If index is after last index of sequence, the default data page will be used to fill space in between. (Default = null, add data page to end of sequence)

member.name: T:AntPlus.Types.PropertyDefaultValueAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute is intended to be used on methods, to set default values of value type properties of reference type parameters of the method, to be displayed in the UI. Example:
[PropertyDefaultValue(typeof(RequestDataPage), "RequestedPageNumber", 82)] [PropertyDefaultValue(typeof(RequestDataPage), "CommandType", Common.Common.CommandType.RequestDataPageFromSlave)] [PropertyDefaultValue(typeof(RequestDataPage), "UseAck", true)] // Request as ack public void SendDataPageRequest(RequestDataPage requestPage)
The method SendDataPageRequest in the example has one parameter of type RequestDataPage. The attributes added to this method will allow the UI to create an instance of RequestDataPage such that the properties "RequestedPageNumber", "CommandType" and "UseAck" will be initialized to the specified values. Note that this is strictly for use with the UI; if calling the method from code (e.g. a script), the caller can create the instance of the parameter, and initialize it as needed. To set the default value of value type parameters, just specify a default value in the method signature (no attributes needed), for example:
public void SendCommand(ushort command = 36)

member.summary: The Radar state data page is sent from the radar when a connected radar display has sent a Turn Off Command. The state data page will indicate to any other radar displays that the radar will shutdown if no command is sent to keep it on.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.BikeSpeedCadence.BikeSpeedCadenceDisplay.DataPageReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time a data page is received. The received data page is passed to any subscribed handlers. Since there is only one page in this profile, there are no additional per page events. A counter that increments with every Rx event is included, to facilitate correlation between multiple events

member.summary: This event is called every time bike speed data is received. In this particular case, this would be every channel period. A counter that increments with every Rx event is included, to facilitate correlation between multiple events

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.BikeSpeedCadence.BikeSpeedCadenceDisplay.BikeCadenceDataReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time bike speed data is received. In this particular case, this would be every channel period. A counter that increments with every Rx event is included, to facilitate correlation between multiple events

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Controls.GenericRemoteControl.SendGenericCommand(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Sends a generic command. Sequence numbers are automatically populated. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received (up to 8 retries). If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.Controls.GenericRemoteControl.SendGenericCommand(AntPlus.Profiles.Common.GenericCommandPage)
member.summary: Sends a generic command, with full control over the contents of the command page (incl. modifying the transmitted serial number and sequence number). This method is only available through scripting. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received (up to 8 retries). If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of a GenericCommandPage to send

member.summary: This event is called every time a command status page for a generic/burst command is received from a controllable device.

member.name: T:AntPlus.Profiles.Geocache.ProgrammableDataConfiguration
member.summary: A class to hold enable information for programmable data. When the geocache device simulator receives programmable data, its corresponding field will be set to true automatically. That data will be added to the transmission pattern. When the geocache device simulator receives a blank programmable data page with the same page number as previously programmed data, its corresponding field will be set to false automatically. That data will be removed from the transmission pattern. If these fields are manipulated manually using the SimulANT+ UI, or via a script, the corresponding data structure will encode or release a programmable data page. That data page will be added to or removed from the transmission pattern as appropriate.

members.member: Simulates a button press event from a remote device. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued. Instance of the request data page to send These attributes are the default values to use when populating the UI

Sends an LEV Remote Cusom Button State Page. The page is sent using the broadcast data type If the simulator is busy sending another message, this message will be queued. Instance of the request data page to send These attributes are the default values to use when populating the UI

Sends a Data Display Page. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued. Instance of the request data page to send These attributes are the default values to use when populating the UI

members.member: Send Commands page manually with full control over the contents of the command page (incl. modifying the transmitted command ID, local time offset and current timestamp). This method is available through the UI, scripting, or may be automatically called when the notifications: UTC time required flag is set. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received (up to 8 retries). If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued. /// Instance of a CommandsPage to send

member.summary: This event is called every time a manufacturer specific page is received.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.DefaultDataPageReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time the default data page (page 0) is received.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.BaseDataPageReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time the base data page (page 4) is received.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.CaloriesPageReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time the calories page is received.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.CapabilitiesPageReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time the capabilities page is received. No counter is included since capabilities are static (at least during a session) and should not change with the real time data.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.SummaryDistanceStridesPageReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time the summary page for distance and stride count is received. No counter is included as this is a request page for summary data and not real time data.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.ManufacturerIdentificationPageReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time the manufacturer ID page is received. No counter is included as no real time data is contained in this page, and the information in this page is static.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.ProductInformationPageReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time the product information page is received. No counter is included as no real time data is contained in this page, and the information in this page is static.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.BatteryStatusPageReceived
member.summary: This event is received every time the common page battery status is received.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.SpeedDataReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time speed data is received (i.e., every channel period, except when manufacturer or product information is received) A counter that increments with every Rx event is included, to facilitate correlation between multiple events

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.DistanceStridesDataReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time distance and stride data are received (i.e., every time the default page 1 is received) A counter that increments with every Rx event is included, to facilitate correlation between multiple events

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.CadenceDataReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time cadence data is received. A counter that increments with every Rx event is included, to facilitate correlation between multiple events

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.CaloriesDataReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time calories data is received. A counter that increments with every Rx event is included, to facilitate correlation between multiple events

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.StrideBasedSpeedDistance.StrideBasedSpeedDistanceDisplay.SdmStatusReceived
member.summary: This event is called every time the SDM status is received. A counter that increments with every Rx event is included, to facilitate correlation between multiple events

member.summary: Sent by the ANT+ controller to the ANT+ dropper seatpost to lock/unlock the ANT+ dropper seatpost.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostSettingsPage.SlaveSerialNumber
member.summary: This value may be used by the ANT+ dropper seatpost to identify the ANT+ controller that sent the command.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostSettingsPage.CommandSequenceNumber
member.summary: Each time a new setting is requested, the command sequence number field shall be incremented.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostSettingsPage.LockSetting
member.summary: The lock setting field indicates if the seatpost valve shall be locked or unlocked to allow for manual adjustment.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostSettingsPage.UnlockDelayValue
member.summary: The seatpost valve shall remain unlocked for the delay time specified in this field (if unlock delay is supported) and lock setting field is set to 1 (unlock).

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostSettingsPage.ConfigurationFlag
member.summary: The unlock delay value configuration flag allows a controller to indicate if the transmitted unlock delay in an unlock command shall overwrite the current unlock delay stored on the seatpost. The configuration flag shall only be set on unlock commands with valid unlock delay values, and when transmitting to seatposts that indicate support for configurable unlock delays.

member.name: T:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostStatusPage
member.summary: The main data page broadcast from an ANT+ dropper seatpost

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostStatusPage.TotalEventCount
member.summary: The total event count field indicates the total number of lock/unlock events that have occurred.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostStatusPage.ConfiguredUnlockDelay
member.summary: The unlock delay field indicates the current setting of the time delay used by the seat post when unlocking.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostStatusPage.ConfigurableDelayIndicator
member.summary: Configurable delay indicator is used to indicate whether the unlock delay value may be changed by the remote control

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.DropperSeatpost.DropperSeatpostStatusPage.ValveState
member.summary: The valve state indicates whether the internal seatpost valve is closed, locking the seat into a fixed position; or open, in which case the seat height can be changed.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BaseBikePowerSensor.GetSetAdvancedCapabilities
member.summary: Get/Set Advanced Capabilities Page. This power sensor does not allow any field to be enabled without first being supported. Should a field be enabled while not supported, it will automatically support that feature. If you turn off support for a feature that is enabled, it will automatically be disabled.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BaseBikePowerSensor.DataPageRequestsEnabled
member.summary: Enable transmission of requestable data pages. Use this option to enable responding requests for summary data, capabilities, and common pages

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BaseBikePowerSensor.AdvancedCapabilitiesPageEnabled
member.summary: Enable transmission of the optional Advanced Capabilities Page. When the advanced capabilities page is enabled, the current settings from the Advanced Capabilities Page will override the current sensor settings. For Example, if the AutoZero Support Data Page has AutoZero enabled and the Advanced Capabilities Page has AutoZero disabled, if the Advanced Capabilities Page transmission is enabled the AutoZero Support Data Page will change its values to match those in the Advanced Capabilities Page (from enabled to disabled).

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerCrankTorqueSensor.AutoResponseParameters
member.summary: Default parameters to use when automatically responding to a calibration request. These parameters are updated based on the Auto Zero Support page, and when receiving an Auto Zero Configuration request from the display; they can also be updated manually at any time. More fine grained control over the contents and behaviour of the calibration response is available through scripting.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerCrankTorqueSensor.PreEncode
member.summary: This event is called every time a broadcast message is going to be sent, before data pages are encoded. This allows changing properties of the data pages prior to transmission.

member.summary: Class to represent a Bike Power Display (Receiver). Additional details are available in the ANT+ Bicycle Power Profile Document.

member.param: ANT network associated to this device

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.TurnOn
member.summary: Turn on simulator and begin searching for a sensor

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.TurnOff
member.summary: Turn off simulator and close channel

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendCalibrationMessage(AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.StandardCalibrationPage)
member.summary: Send a calibration page. This method can be used to send any of the calibration pages from scripts It is not available on the UI. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of the calibration page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendCustomCalibrationParameterRequest(AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.RequestCustomCalibrationParameterPage)
member.summary: Send a Custom Calibration Parameter Request page (0xBA). This method can be used to send the calibration page from scripts It is not available on the UI. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of the custom calibration parameter request page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendSetCustomCalibrationParameterPage(AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.SetCustomCalibrationParameterPage)
member.summary: Send a Set Custom Calibration Parameter page (0xBC). This method can be used to send the calibration page from scripts It is not available on the UI. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of the set custom calibration parameter page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendGeneralCalibrationRequest(AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.GeneralCalibrationRequestPage)
member.summary: Sends a general (Manual Zero) calibration request (0xAA). The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of the general calibration request page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendAutoZeroConfiguration(AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.AutoZeroConfigurationPage)
member.summary: Sends a Auto Zero Configuration calibration request (0xAB). The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of the auto zero configuration page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendCtfCalibrationSlopeRequest(AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.CtfCalibrationSlopeRequestPage)
member.summary: Sends a CTF slope calibration request CalID:0xAB, CTFID: 0x02). The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of the CTF calibration slope request page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendCtfCalibrationSerialNumberRequest(AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.CtfCalibrationSerialNumberRequestPage)
member.summary: Sends a CTF Serial Number Calibration request CalID: 0x01, CTFID:0x03. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of the CTF calibration serial number request page to send

members.member: Sends a Get/Set Parameters Page (sub: Crank Parameters) Sub:0x01. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued. Instance of the Get/Set Crank Parameters page to send These attributes are the default values to use when populating the UI

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendGetCrankParametersRequest(System.Byte)
member.summary: Sends common data page 70 to request the Get/Set Crank Parameters page (DP 0x02, SubP 0x01, Crank Parameters). The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Number of times the sensor is requested to respond with the requested data page

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendDataPageRequest(AntPlus.Profiles.Common.RequestDataPage)
member.summary: Sends common data page 70 to request a specified data page (Default = 82, Battery Status). The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued.
member.param: Instance of the request data page to send

member.name: M:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerDisplay.SendAdvancedCapabilities(AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.GetSetAdvancedCapabilitiesPage)
member.summary: Sends a Get/Set Parameters Page (sub: Advanced Capabilities) Sub:0xFD. The page is sent using the acknowledged data type, until an acknowledgement is received. If the simulator is busy sending another message, it will be queued. In order to send this page the Display must first request the Advanced Capabilities Page from the sensor to aquire its status.
member.param: Instance of the Get/Set Advanced Capabilities page to send

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerWheelTorqueSensor.AutoResponseEnabled
member.summary: Enables sending a response to a calibration request (manual zero/auto zero) automatically. The Auto Response Calibration Parameters are used in the response. More fine grained control over the contents and behaviour of the calibration response is available through scripting.

member.name: P:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerWheelTorqueSensor.AutoResponseParameters
member.summary: Default parameters to use when automatically responding to a calibration request. These parameters are updated based on the Auto Zero Support page, and when receiving an Auto Zero Configuration request from the display; they can also be updated manually at any time. More fine grained control over the contents and behaviour of the calibration response is available through scripting.

member.name: E:AntPlus.Profiles.BikePower.BikePowerWheelTorqueSensor.PreEncode
